revised_title: Critical Point and Phase Transitions in Carbonic Acid
tldr: The author, Thomas Andrews, conducted experiments on carbonic acid to study the transition between its gaseous and liquid states. He discovered a critical point at 30°C where carbonic acid ceases to liquefy by pressure. Andrews found that the transition between the gaseous and liquid states can be made continuous, with no interruption or breach of continuity. This research sheds light on the continuity of matter and the behavior of other substances like nitrous oxide, hydrochloric acid, ammonia, and sulfur compounds.
